title: Five Stars
body: GREAT ADDITION TO MY EDC!

title: this one is awesome. very light and easy to use
body: multi-tools have come a long way since I bought my first one 22 years ago. this one is awesome. very light and easy to use.

title: carry every day!
body: Excellent tool to carry every day when you don't need enough tools to assemble a space shuttle. Reason for 4 star is that my fear about the driver bit storage was realized the first day i carried it. I dropped it on cement. Bummed about the little scratch it took. To bummed I guess to notice that the bit stored in the handle had popped out. What really stinks is I can't just buy a single replacement. So my clumsiness is going to cost me 25 bucks. Yeah, half the price of the tool for a single lost bit.

title: Four Stars
body: Good product.

title: Valentine's gift!
body: I bought this as a gift for my husband and he loved it. He put together a cabinet using it on its own when he didn't have his tool box at hand. We used it when we moved houses for odd jobs here and there. The finishing for the screw driver got scratched with use but this is expected with tools. The material itself is light but strong, and the knife is sharp. I will recommend it to the general population but maybe not for people with arthritis or joints pain. Also be careful using the screw driver which can be tricky.

title: everyday multi tool cool factor
body: this is the 2nd one i have bought because a friend decided to keep my other one.prossharp 154cm steel knife bladelots of toolsleatherman customer service is top notchrelatively light weight for a multi toolreliable have not had any breakagesconscould have more tools but would make it heavier

title: Love it, great knife.
body: Recieved this as a gift from the other half. What a great tool. Lighter than I expected, and feels very solid. The blade is still very sharp(ive had it for about 6months), and it really is a high quality looking tool. The steel of the blade looks awesome, and performs flawlessly. It has a needle point, and is at the perfect curvature for cutting almost anything, no serrates are required. The flat tip and phillips head work great, not as great as a standard phillips head screwdriver, but its a lot easier than having to go get one, and works almost as well. They are not magnetic, wish they were tbh, but I love how they are stored, rather than just having 1 phillips and 1 flat head, you have 2 of each,or atleast 2 sizes.The pliers feel solid, and somewhat click/lock into place firmly. I wish the steel of the pliers was made of the same steel as the blade, because I can see a few wear spots when gripping steel occasionally. But it still looks good, and performs well. I carry this knife every day, it fits in the pocket nicely, but I tend to keep it on the far side of my pocket, because if you reach too hard in your pocket with that thing over to the left some, you can end up with a painfull scratch from the back corner of the blade.The carabiner/bottle opener works perfectly, havent had a bottle it cant open yet, and the little clip actually holds onto the bottle cap most of the time, so it doesnt fly off somewhere, truely awesome. It also doesnt show signs of use, or wear, its designed perfectly, really couldnt think of a better way to design it.Ive never had a leatherman, but usually prefer a gerber, however this one has sold me quite well. If all leathermans are designed as such, I will consider them twice. Gerber seems to make more full featured knives, and I wasnt looking for one, just an EDC, and this won the fight.

title: Nice
body: A very nice tool to keep with you.  I carry it on my waist band and I don't even know its there.  All the features are very handy, i mean who really needs  a saw with them everyday?  The only thing is the dark coating they call 'tungsten coated' and scratch resistant already scratched on mine w/in a couple weeks.  But then again I don't keep it in my pocket like maybe i should.  However, all the tools work fine and the carbon fiber is a nice touch because it acts as a cushion for your palm when using the pliers.  I would recomend this tool to anyone!

title: But great little tool for day to day work
body: The blade is a bit short and the holes in it are definitely not practical for cleaning. But great little tool for day to day work.

title: A good
body: Well made. A good product

title: Great quality
body: After purchasing 2 other multi tools I decided to give leatherman a try and I couldn't be happier.  I previously tried a Gerber crucial fast which arrived broken, and 2 SOG B66 power assist that neither straight blade worked properly on.  The crucial just felt cheap in comparison anyway but it was considerably less money.  The Sog was in a different category but it felt very solid in hand and the pliers were definitely much stronger than the Leatherman.  Unfortunately the SOG's had awful quality control in my opinion.  I've tried SOG Flash so I know there knives with assist open do work properly.    Anyway back to the Leatherman. It has a nice feel in hand with a solid blade compared to the others.  I'm personally glad the newer CX models have a straight edge blade instead of the partially serrated as I feel it's more useful day to day.  I can't attest to longevity but after initial impressions I would recommend this to everyone, and have read nothing but good things about Leatherman's 25 year warranty.

title: Great tool... tough, at a very low weigh
body: If you have a "travel light" requirement or penchant, this is the tool for you.  It has all of the functionality and strength that I expect from a Leatherman product and due to the alloy of he metal and skeletonization, is about half the weight of the standard one.

title: Leatherman Skeletool
body: Finally a multitool that 99% of us can use 99% of the time!  With a knife located on the outside of the tool that is quick and easy to get to, two Phillips heads, two flat heads, pliers and wire cutters, one can do any job you would think of tackling with a multitool.  For after the job is done, throw in the Bottle Open which doubles as a Carabiner (fancy word for belt clip) and this is truly a great multitool.  Light weight and good looking does not hurt its appeal either.  I already put mine through its paces and I highly recommend the Skeletool.

title: But disappointing and sad. My SOG multitool has been through much harsher ...
body: It served me quite faithfully for a long time. Then one side of the pliers broke clean off and hit me in the face. I got my money's worth. But disappointing and sad. My SOG multitool has been through much harsher plying and is still whole.

title: Five Stars
body: my favorite knife

title: If you only get ONE Leatherman, this is the one
body: Light weight, no nonsense, sharp blade, one hand flick to open.I keep this with me always. Always smooth opening.Pliers broke, Leatherman replaced it. No problem.

title: Cool and durable.  Functionally great and useful.  Buy the pouch with it.
body: Every man's tool.  Durable and worth the money.

title: Nice tool for small quick jops
body: Be careful that knife is SHARP. Together with the bit set its great.

title: Good tool, but...
body: This is a great tool, all the essentials, none of the garbage.  Also, it doesn't need a holster since it clips right to your belt - which is nice.  Shame on Amazon for taking a week to ship this.  They used to ship items within a day, but they've been stretching their dates out further and further over the years - probably to urge people to pay for shipping.  Again, shame on Amazon.

title: Near Perfect
body: I've never purchased a Leatherman or Leatherman like product before simply because they were all so gimmicky with loads of stuff one really would rarely use and they were heavy for all day every day carry. This one is great. It has all the stuff you need and none that you don't. It is light weight and very functional and it is easy to carry. The knife blade is very sharp and locks in place very safely. Plus the design and use of materials is outstanding. As a real functional tool in size and weight you can't beat it. Now if they just could have added a saw it would have everything. If you are an outdoors person or in SAR this is definitely your knife.

title: Great tool in a small package
body: Just received my Skeletool CX and my first impression was wow.  I had pre-ordered it months ago and it arriving was a surprise, it's great when you get a present for yourself.  Its light with minimalist lines, yet when you open it, it feels comfortable in your hand.  The knife blade is large compared to the entire package but it's smaller then I expected.  It's not a replacement for the full sized Leatherman but something that can do almost everything the full sized one can with a fraction of the space.No problem with the bit driver like the 2 star reviewer. I'm a Leatherman/Gerber nut and so far, I like this one a lot.  It's a great tool to have when pocket space is at a premium.

title: NON SERRATED 154CM BLADE!!!!
body: Thought people would want to know that this NEW 154CM steel version does not come with the serrated edge blade, as compared to what some of the user uploaded photos show. The lower quality 420HC steel blade is serrated though on the non CX model.I thought this was a drawback till I realized that: 1. I really don't use serrated blades that much. 2. They are also harder to sharpen perfectly. 3. The harder/sharper 154CM steel makes a serrated edge less relevant.I love the tool and the grip on the pliers is very comfortable and lightweight.  I really enjoy the locking system for the bit piece, quite ingenious. Though proprietary bit pieces of course.I gave it one less star as the spare bit holder is a little loose of a design, and might have to crimp it in there more to ensure it doesn't fall out during heavy usage.  We'll see!

title: Excellent multi tool for the above average do-it yourselfer
body: Excellent multi tool for the above average do-it yourselfer. I received this as a christmas gift a few years back and upon first sight, i thought that it was going to be like the other few multi tools that i own(the ones that stay in the drawer because they are big and bulky) but it wasn't. I wore it for a day which turned into a week than a year and nows it on me everyday. The knife blade is made from a higher quality steel(154cm) than your average knife and stays sharp a long time as long as you take care of it. The top three uses of this multi-tool are the knife, screwdriver bits, and the bottle opener. Just get one...you will enjoy it.

title: Quality as expected
body: Smaller than expected, but in a good way.  Compact and sturdy.  Will come in handy for those times you need a quick tool (i.e.  knife, plyers, screwdriver, bottle opener).

title: Love this tool
body: I don't go anywhere without my skelly. I feel naked without it I lost mine skiing I ordered another one immediately

title: Five Stars
body: OK

title: Awesome tool,
body: Most of the pocket mulitools have too much stuff that you never use and are bit too cumbersome. The skeletool CX is just right.Folding knife, pliers, screwdriver, bottle opener, wire cutter. What else do you really need?

title: The best part of your EDC!
body: Simple, good quality, and it gets the job done. The order of usefulness for me is the knife, pliers, phillips screwdriver, and on rare occasions the bottle opener comes in handy. I LOVE being able to open and close the knife with one hand. That ups the ante a LOT, for me. If I lost it, I would feel really bad for a while, and then buy another Leatherman (maybe this one, maybe something different). If you are thinking of getting one of these, go for it. You won't be disappointed.

title: Five Stars
body: WORKS AS INTENDED

title: Best pocket multitool!
body: I have owned a lot of multitools, this one is by far my favorite. It is just the right size to fit in your pocket, and is well thought out, high quality and very handy. If you work in construction or something where you will use this constantly it will probably be a little small, but for everyday light use it is ideal. I have bought this tool twice, the first one went for a swim on a fishing trip and if lose this one I will buy a third one. Its that good.

title: Five Stars
body: Another AWESOME Product by Leatherman!!!  The clip makes this as easy to carry as a simple pocket knife.

title: Very solid and reliable multitool! I have used it for 2 years!
body: I have used this for over 2 years, and it never fails on me. My Skeletool CX always sits in my bag, to-date no loose parts, and the blade is still sharp!

title: very sharp
body: Great handy small lightweight tool.The only thing missing for me is a wood saw.The 154cm blade stays sharper for longer..

title: Just the basics
body: I work in tech support and after a disastrous office move I decided enough was enough and snagged me this tool I'd been considering for a while. As a lady with average sized hands I felt it fit comfortably. The tool has a good weight so you know if it's missing. The carabiner clip is great for my belt loop and the clip works great in my pocket. This tool was great for me, I just needed something to open packages quickly and easily the basic bits they included work great and I'll probably soon be picking up the expanded bit set. The pliers work great and were the other main reason for my purchase. Besides that the wire cutter and stripper are a bit small for some of the wiring I work with but for household use or a pinch I think it would do great. Also the black is quite stylish, and yes I have gotten compliments on my multitool. No need for a holster with this bad boy, show him off! Only Con is the bottle opener is a bit cumbersome as it's built in with the carabiner. Still Love this tool though!

title: Five Stars
body: Quick and easy. Thanks.

title: A Great Compact Tool Box
body: This little multitool is truly a mini-toolbox that fits nicely in your pocket. Great blade - just right for small tasks, without being bulky; the pliers are perfect for most light tasks. I expected a flimsy little tool, with limited use, BUT I was pleasantly surprised with how solid and durable this mini-multitool actually is. I strongly recommend it if you are looking for a new pocket knife that does alot more than just cut stuff.  GJM

title: This is my every day carry, fairly light use ...
body: This is my every day carry, fairly light use and no issues yet. Really lightweight compared to some previous multitools, lighter than my last pocket knife even.

title: Great pocket tool
body: Very nice and handy tool.  The only thing that I really don't like is that when you use your thumb to swing the knife blade out it is really easy to cut your finger and darn it's sharp.

title: good tool, works well
body: mostly all good. only drawback might be the sharp corner of the back of the blade - if its riding in your right pocket and you dig around for your keys chances are you may get bit. but it's a tool and a very good one at that.

title: EVERYONE should have!
body: This knife is irreplacable, it's a high quality, and it's light for carrying every single day.  My husband lost this in my house somewhere and he was NOT happy without it.  He complained about every single knife that we bought to replace it, until we found it (under our couch).  He uses it every single day to do something and as a boat mechanic it comes in handy for quick fixes.  An all-in-one tool and something I would recommend.

title: The compact life saver, not a replacement for your fancy multi tool.
body: No spring loaded pliers. Expected more from Leatherman. Other than that a great and portable tool.

title: Perfect for its intended purpose.
body: If you are thinking of buying the Skeletool or Skeletook CX, then you probably aren't looking for a multitool that has every possible gadget. It has a knife, a bit driver, a good set of pliers, a pocket clip, and a small carabiner clip that doubles as a bottle opener. That is all. It does not have scissors, a file or a saw. It does not come with a sheath. It comes with two double-ended driver bits - one with two sizes of phillips head and one with two sizes of flat head. These are proprietary bits so you cannot use any other bits from other tools you may already own. I strongly recommend ordering the Leatherman bit set right off the bat. It's mainly intended for backpackers who don't really need basic tools to repair and maintain gear in the field while keeping weight to a minimum.  It's about the same size and weight as my Benchmade Stryker folding pocket knife and I find it comfortable to carry in my pocket or clipper to my pack or belt loop (though that's a good way to rip a belt loop and lose the tool).     The big debate is whether the CX model is worth the extra money or whether you should just buy the regular Skeletool. Both models weigh 5 ounces so the carbon fiber is decorative rather than genuinely weight-saving. The CX is a little sharper looking due to its darker color, but I paid the extra money to get the better knife blade. The blade on the CX is made of the tougher 154CM steel as opposed to the 420HC used for the regular Skeletool's blade. It should hold an edge better and take a little more abuse than the regular Skeletool's blade. The blade on the CX is also a partially serrated 'Combo edge' that gives it an improved ability to cut through tough webbing or ropes if necessary.

title: Leatherman 830850 Skeletool CX Multitool
body: Love this knife for my EDC. I just hook the caribiner on a belt loop and it is ready for me to use at any time. The blade is sharp enough, the screwdriver is functional enough, the pliers are good enough, it works well as a bottle opener, and it's not too big. Overall, this does 95% of what I need a multitool to do in a package that is light, functional, and at my fingertips. I haven't found another multitool with the same qualities and I've looked.If you need an EDC and don't mind that it is out where people can see you're carrying a multitool, if you like that you don't need to keep it in your pocket, if you don't need a survival tool on your belt but can use something simple, this is probably a good choice for you.

title: Very good straight forward tool
body: It's exactly what I expected. One amazing blade, cuts through everything. Plier has really good grip. Bottle opener / carabiner is a great feature and the philips / screwdriver does a good job at quick fixes. Best of all fits in your pocket, so it's with you every time you need it. To top it all the design is awesome.

title: Sexiest looking and feeling multitool I've bought...
body: The Skeletool and I have had a fairly long on again, off again relationship I have purchased this tool 3 times and returned it twice.  It has to be the best looking and feeling multitool I've ever laid my eyes and hands on. I have to say that it's not the most practical nor is it the most capable.  I somehow liken the Skeletool CX to a hot chick that doesn't have the greatest personality. One tends to overlook a few inadequacies because it's just so darn gorgeous.  In 2011, I had just purchased my first Leatherman Multitool, the Wave for $77.00 at Walmart one week before purchasing the Skeletool for the very first time. It was the Stainless Steel version bought for $70.00 at Paragon Sports. I admired the overall look of the tool, but after comparing it's cost vs it's capabilities to the Leatherman Wave. It just didn't make sense to spend that much money to something which was more of a knife than a Multitool to me. I decided to return it.  In recent years in NYC where I live, the strict and often controversial interpretation of gravity knife laws have lead to many arrests. In NYC virtually any locking folder can be articulated and presented as a gravity knife. This has lead me to reevaluate my EDC. I sought advise from Kniferight.org and local law enforcement. Knige rights advised me refrain from carrying a locking folder for the moment, while NYPD advised against carrying any serrated blade and preferred that if one must carry a bladed tool that a Leatherman or Multitool would be best as a locking folding knife was often viewed as a weapon and not a tool.  Ultimately their advise pointed me to the Skeletool CX, a multitool with a non-serrated blade. I purchased my Skeletool CX for just under $65.00 including tax. After a week of carrying it in my pocket it just felt too bulky and I honestly still prefer carrying my former EDC, a Gerber Paraframe I and a Leatherman Squirt. I have carried this combination for many years and have been so pleased with it's light weightand size. I decided to return the Skeletool CX once again only to purchase it a few days later.  I am keeping it and I'll give you the reasons why.  154 CM Blade Steel Tungsten DLC On frame Carbon Fiber inlay in the handle. The best ergonomic feel and rounded edges on any Leatherman.  Yes gents, shes not perfec, she may not have a saw or a pair of scissors, but she's beautiful in her own way.  I have had my eyes set on knives with 154 cm bladesteel and also Carbon Fiber handles this multitool allows me to add both to my collection for just $65.00

title: A wonderful multi-tool that I keep with me every day
body: A wonderful multi-tool that I keep with me every day.  Comes with most of the tools that I need and has a convenient and good-quality knife.  The black is a nice, stylish touch.

title: Very, very sharp knife! Extremely well made. ...
body: Very,very sharp knife!  Extremely well made.  Unlimited uses!

title: Comfortable, solid, and the perfect size.
body: After patiently waiting four months to receive my Skeletool from Amazon it finally came.  The CX is smaller than I initially expected but it really is as big as it needs to be.  It feels comfortable in the hand and looks amazing.  There is very little flex when using the pliers, although it is possible to pinch your thumb between the handles if you are not careful.  The knife can be opened with one hand and locks in place nicely.  The bit driver feature also has a locking lever which is pressed to change bits.  I've owned other multi-tools (i.e. gerber, swiss army) and never used all the features.  The CX has the essentials leaving it light weight and well balanced.  Just clip it to the inside of your pocket with the belt clip and you can't even tell it is there.  I highly recommend it.

title: after 6 months I carry it always - love it
body: This is a truly curious tool.  As a network consultant, I need philips head, knife, pliers, cable stripping from time to time.  Here is how I rank the usefulness of this Skeletool:    overall built in features: 7 out of 10 - strangely the ability to snap it onto a belt loop or d ring on a bag is as useful as the belt clip    Knife usefulness:  8 out of 10 - the 154 steel does really sharpen well (I use a spyderco ceramic sharpening system) holds a very sharp edge well.  The shape of the blade makes it very easy to deploy one handed.  The liner lock ensures safety when using this type of tool which does not have the ideal handle.      Screwdriver utility:  9 out of 10.  If it had a round handle I would say it is perfect but the bit holder and the second bit allow for dual size philips and flat blade without the auxiliary bit kit. I did buy the extra bits but hardly ever use them.     Pliers utility:  Some have mentioned that the palm is easily pinched - yes that will happen if you do not hold the tool with the rounded portion at your palm.  If it feels wrong, just turn it around and p;lace the side without the knife blade in your fingers and the pliers feel great.  NO pinching. The slight needle nose makes it possible to get the jaws into small areas as well.  Kudos for a great tool!

title: Great stuff
body: Ive always been a Gerber user and fan, but this leatherman turned me around. Its slick and well made. I expect many years of non-use with this bad boy :)

title: great product
body: The item is exactly as described by the seller.  The knife was sharp and the multitool also looks super cool.  A little pricey compared to some of the other versions out there, but I'm extremely happy with this product.

title: Great Multitool!
body: This has been in my pocket since i bought it.  I use it everyday at work, and take it backpacking with me.  It doesn't have 300 fold out gadgets, just some basic functions that almost anyone would need.  The changeable bits are great, and don't weigh a lot at all.  I was skeptical about losing them at first, but I haven't had any trouble at all with them.  Great quality for the price, and for those of us who just want things we will actually use day-to-day, this is the tool.Update: December 2010Almost a year and a half later, I carry this everywhere and use it at least a few times a day.  This tool has saved my [...] more than a few times and wouldn't think twice about purchasing another one if I lost it or something.  The blade still is sharp, and pliers are prefect.  The screwdriver bits you can tell are used, but they aren't worn bad at all considering I use them daily.

title: Just what I needed and nothing I don't
body: This is my fourth Leatherman product. The first was my original Leatherman bought back in the early 90's and it got me through countless video shoots. Over the course of the past 20 years, my needs and priorities concerning the tools I carry have changed. The Skeletool CX covers me in almost every simple job that work throws at me. It's light, well made, carries just like a pocket knife and will quickly get you out of life's little jams. Plus, you're supporting American manufacturing, which in and of itself is a great reason to buy a Skeletool.  People that break them from over exertion are missing the point of this tool and most certainly using it for the wrong tasks whether they admit it or not. Buy one, you'll like it. Just don't use it like a torque wrench.

title: Perfect gift for Hubby
body: Hubby has been eyeing this up for ages.  Was the perfect gift for him has a screw driver plyers knife and bottle opener... Very quick service, postage was as stipulated ( actually a little quicker) well packaged and vey happy with item thanks

title: Battle Tested
body: First off I would like to say I am a Marine and had the Skeletool CX with me through a deployment work-up and a deployment to Afghanistan. I have had many multitools and knives over the years but this one was the first true combination of both. I'll start out with the bad first, the pliers broke in Afghanistan when my buddy was trying to torque a pin out of a .50-Cal cradle and the blade is ground down so both sides are about the same sharpness (granted I never sharpened it and the environment is fairly tough on equipment). For the pros this tool was able to do anything a normal multitool could do and I love the way the knife was situated for ergonomics when cutting, the clip on the end was useful for clipping the tool to my belt loops for fast attach and detaching. Overall this is an excellent tool and I would and do recommend it to anyone who needs a basic multitool or knife.

title: Almost Perfect
body: Beautifully made with all the tools that I use regularly and none that I don't.  Just wish there was a left hand version (one hand openning is quite difficult with the left hand)

title: Glad I bought it
body: Works as advertised. Glad I bought it.

title: Five Stars
body: As advertised. My husband loves it and uses it all the time.

title: Five Stars
body: Perfect!

title: My 40 Something Brother Had This On His Christmas Wish List
body: My brother loves this and keeps it handy, especially at Christmas time.  We need it to help the children open all their toys from the packaging!  It's a great tool and my brother says he uses it every day!

title: Love my Leatherman skeletool
body: I love my Leatherman Skeletool.  It meets my needs without being too big or bulky.  I have a larger swiss army knife, but for most tasks the skeletool does the job.  Even better is Leatherman's customer service and warranty.  While working on a project at home the pliers broke, making the tool effectively useless.  After a quick e-mail exchange with customer service I sent the tool to them by mail, and a little more than a week later the tool came back good as new.  No hassles.

title: Skeletool CX
body: Finally received my CX.  Removing it from the package I was very pleased with the overall feel of the tool, the fit and finishes are excellent and there are no immediately noticeable sharp edges.  It was slightly heavier than I thought it would be, a little heavier than my usual EDC pocket knife, but not bad.  Like other reviewers before me I noticed that the carbon fiber may reduce the weight very slightly, however I think it mostly serves to make the tool more aesthetically pleasing. I don't have the problems with the bits that another review had, the bit in the bit holder is held in by a catch that has to be depressed to remove the bit, The other bit is very secure in the handle, although it may get loose once there is some wear on the bit.  The bottle opener works and now I'll carry it around for a while and see how it feels in the pocket.  All in all I'm very happy with the tool, it has most of the tools I use the most, lacking only the scissors, in a smaller lighter package.    Update - carried it around all day in business casual dress, the position of the pocket clip and the slim profile allow it to ride unobtrusively and comfortably in my pocket.

title: My new EDC
body: I love my leatherman charge tti , but for every day carry the skeletool cx rules ! The blade is outstanding ,and I also have the convenience of a bit driver with phillips and flat heads, and a decent pliers . I like the fact that my bit driver extension and accessory bit kit can work with the skeletool.

title: Loves.it.
body: I was told I needed a leatherman tool for a job I was doing. This thing is FANTASTIC! I highly recommend it.

title: Dave
body: I bought this for my son for Christmas. He is in the Air Force Secial Forces (Pararescue)and this was on his Christmas list. He only buys the best equipment so this has got to be good.

title: It's so good that I carry it everywhere with me
body: I don't leave home without it. And even at home I prefer to grab it and use it instead of looking for a screwdriver, knife or a bottle opener. I use the pliers least often but when I do I'm really glad that I have them in my pocket.The knife is just awesome - sharp, opens easily with one hand and has this pleasing click when it locks.This is not a heavy-duty tool. It's great for everyday taks but if you know that you'll use it for more serious tasks then shell out some more money for a full-sized leatherman.The build quality is awesome, nothing is loose, has just the perfect combination of tools. I'm hooked up on multitools now and plan to purchase Letaherman Wave with pocket clip just to see how the "bigger" leatherman works for me.All in all, it's a great tool for a gentleman. Sits comfortably in your back pocket. It's really satisfying when you can be the man and save the day. And with this tool it happens often! :)

title: Great
body: I read the reviews and was a little leery. I bought it anyway. Great replacement for my pocket knife. I've used all the tools for one reason or another. I think this thing is awesome.

title: Five Stars
body: great knife highly recommend

title: Just the essentials thats all work flawlessly
body: This is my second Skeletool the first I somehow lost! I didn't think I needed to replace it because I have three other Leatherman tools, but I was wrong. My Charge ALX pretty much stays at home for light duty (too heavy to pocket comfortably), the Style CS pretty much stays on the key chain for emergency and minor things. The Wingman is basically my everyday carry to work. It's economical and has the basic tools I need but, the quality isn't there. The Skeletool CX has the basic in tools and the quality you would expect from Leatherman plus it is light weight and the blade is phenomenal. It's the perfect tool for me to travel with and keep on me on my days off

title: perfect
body: Love the new model color and function are perfect ordered as replacement,  once you have had one you wont be able to live without it

title: Best Multitool
body: This is the best multitool I ever owned. Light weight. Has two clips. Real knife blade. Equal parts pocket knife multitool. Great price for what you get.

title: Great simple tool
body: Great simple tool, wish the bits were of the same quality as the tool though since they are no where near as nice.

title: Love it great product
body: Just what I wanted needed to make the day much easier.  If you are a tech BUY ONE TODAY.  thanks

title: Five Stars
body: Fast shipping, original article as promised

title: It's been in my pocket for a year...
body: I reach for my skeletool all the time. Having pliers, a sharp knife, screw drivers and a bottle opener I use this thing daily. It doesn't have a single feature I don't use so I don't have to waste pocket space. It also fits in the coin pocket of the [[ASIN:B0018OMRWQ Levi's Men's 501 Shrink To Fit Jean]] for fast access. This leatherman would make for the perfect gift for any man in your life.

title: Five Stars
body: Perfect multitool and beautiful at that! Never leaves my side!

title: They Finally Nailed It!
body: If I had a dollar for every douchebag that whipped out his HUGE leatherman multitool to try to justify that he paid a hundred bucks for the thing, I'd have an @ssload of dollars. It's also so big that you have to have a special douchey holder for it on your belt.  (It's the same guy with his cell phone in a pouch on his belt on the otherside, btw)  I mean they're great, but you have to pull a transformer move just to use them for anything.  Need to decode a nuke?  No problem, the leatherman has got you covered.  Just need a knife?  No problem, the multi-tool has got that too.  Hope you don't need it quick though, because it's going to take about five minutes to get the thing out of the pouch, find the knife, open it, then close the handle so you can actually use it.  It really is a process.All I ever wanted was a multitool that has the things I need most in a pinch and a way to get to them quickly.  Oh, and if I could not look like a huge douchebag with the pouch on the side of my belt, that would be nice.  And holy crap they listened!  Enter the skeletool!  It's got a clip on the side so you can just clip it to your pocket.  Access isn't in an isse, and clipped like that, you don't notice it either.  The knife blade (the thing you actually use most) is on the 'outside' of the tool so you can open it and close it without unfolding the entire thing.  Awesome.  So it's got a pliers, a screwdriver (both phillips and flat), and a knife.  I'm a handyman by trade and I swear that with this thing and my cordless drill, I can do about 95% of my fixes.  My only complaint is that they say you have '9 tools', but they count the pliers as three or four because you can do different things with different parts of the jaws.  So does that mean that most of the pliers that I have at home are 'multi-tools'?  Hardly, but don't tell Leatherman that.  Also, apparently the black one costs more because it's black.  I don't know why leatherman has to be rascist like that.  I'llget over it as I spent the extra money to get the black one and I'd do it again.  I just like the look of it better.  But if you don't care, get the silver one and save yourself a couple of bucks.  Speaking of that, a hearty Huzzah! to Amazon for carrying it for thirty bucks less than everyone else.Thank you Leatherman for finally making something that you can used without a ten minute-transformy production and that I don't have to look like an @sshat because I carry the monster around all of the time on my belt.  My name is Tim, and I approve this Skeletool.

title: perfect for EDC.
body: the Leatherman CX is perfect for Every Day Carry. It has most features you'll need in a medium duty day setting. I use a Gerber Diesel at work but for EDC this is the piece you need. Very slim and non-obtrusive in your pocket. The craftsmanship is incredible. You really get what you pay for with this product.

title: Dr. Who has his Sonic Screwdriver, I have my Leatherman Skeletool
body: I have not faced a job that I could not do with this tool.  Along with the Leatherman 931014 40-Bit Assortment for Leatherman Bit Drivers, there is no job you can't tackle.  It's sturdy, lightweight and easy to use.

title: Good Tool
body: This is my first Leatherman and I am happy with the purchase. The craftsmanship is good and I use it all the time. I would recommend this to a friend.

title: Great Tool
body: This is a great multipurpose tool. It is a perfect weight and size so that I can carry it in my pocket everyday without it becoming annoying. The quality of the tool is perfect. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a tool with the basic items and a reasonable price.

title: Awesome tool! Never leave home without it
body: The leatherman skeletool cx is by far one of the best items I have bought on Amazon. It is much lighter and more compact than my leatherman wave, and it has all the features that I actually use.One of the best parts about it is the screwdriver with interchangealbe heads. most of the time the screwdrivers on pocket knives are a useless size, this tool eliminates that problem.The main knife blade came very sharp right out of the box, and it seems to be holding its edge extremely well.The bottle opener / clip works great, if you open a bottle with it, the cap actually gets retained by the clip so you don't drop it :)The pliers work well, and have two different wire cutters built in.Overall this is an excellent product and I never leave home without it!

title: Great lil tool
body: i love this tool. i always carry it around clipped to my belt loop.    when i first received the tool, i opened it up right away to get a feel for it. i noticed that i was bleeding a short while later. it turns out i just nicked my finger with the knife. the knife itself is VERY sharp. i highly doubt i'm going to need to sharpen it anytime soon.    the tool bits (phillips and fathead screwdriver heads) seem to work pretty well, even though they are flattened. i've used them for around the house objects where the screws were a bit too loose, and managed to tighten them, no problem.    i haven't really used the jaws yet, only the wire cutter part, which works like a charm

title: Leatherman Skeletool CX
body: Lack of spring for pliers would have been nice but the tool is of high quality, looks cool, and is small/light enough to carry in my pocket. I carry this with me every where I go. Oh and the knife is razor sharp (but not serrated).

title: i would recommend this
body: Everything is great except the curved handle on the plier grip makes it awkward to handle.. Don't get me wrong, the pliers work good anyway. But that's why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5.

title: Five Stars
body: Very useful.

title: Perfect minimalist EDC tool
body: I carry a Leatherman tool every day without fail, and have done so for the last 15 years.  I can't even count how many times my Leatherman has saved my butt or saved the day! I've carried a Wave for about the past 10 years and it's been the best tool I've ever had. I honestly don't understand why every man doesn't carry a Leatherman. I received a SOG EOD tool as a Christmas gift a couple years ago.  It looked cool, but snapped the screwdriver bit and cut my hand badly the first time I tried to use it.  After carrying the Wave for so many years I thought I'd try a lighter, slimmer tool that I could pocket clip carry.  So far, I love this Skeletool CX.  I doesn't have the 'toolbox' selection of tools that the Wave has, but it has the most important and commonly used ones.  The blade is great quality steel and came sharp enough to shave with.  If you're looking for a tool that has the basics, is easy to carry, and is typical Leatherman high quality, you found it.

title: Just what I had been looking for!
body: Great product! Got it for Christmas. Replaced my Swiss Army knife that I have carried for 20+ years. Needed a larger knife. Love how you do not need to open the pliers to get to the knife. I use it quite often throughout the week. Have used the pliers and bits several times as well. Good weight. Like how it sits on my pocket. Had a sharp edge on the back of the blade when it is closed and clipped to my pocket. So when I would put my hand in the pocket it would scratch. Filed it down a bit and all is good again.

title: Good EDC tool
body: Love it! A tad pricey, but worth it as it's easier to carry than the big ones. I carry this in my pants pocket. Actually got some for my groomsmen as gifts and they all loved them!

title: Nice but needs to come with a case
body: I added several pictures so people can see this item close up. I've only had it for a couple of days and it seems to be pretty nice. I'm giving it 4 starts because it doesn't come with any type of carrying case. I hope the pictures help.

title: Excellent
body: The Skeletool CX is excellent. My heavy-duty choice is the Supertool 300, medium-duty Wave and light-duty-everyday is the Skeletool CX. You have two carry choices: One with the sturdy side clip and one with you using your upgraded sheath for the Wave that I am sure you already own. You will not be sorry purchasing the Skeletool CX. Buy this model to have the straight blade which is not hard to maintain. The bits are interchangeable and replaceable. I recommend carrying casually with the side clip and light duty with a sheath and bit driver extender. Remember this is light duty. That being said, the pliers are strong and will not break if you don't use them beyond their capacity. You won't be sorry....great tool!

title: Nice pice right their
body: Great in my pocket as a keychain bottle opener, knife, screwdrivers, and pliers all in one

title: Five Stars
body: Just a neat, clever, durable designed tool.

title: Not the Leatherman I remember...
body: I found this Skeletool a bit too small for my hand and awkward to use.  The knife blade is sloppily sharpened, and nowhere near the razor sharpness of the Leatherman tool I purchased over 5 years ago.  Not nearly as much value for the price, and although the belt clip is a nice touch, the few tools were a disappointment.      As if to try to embellish the product, the packaging described the wire cutting area as two separate 'tools', the 'regular' wire cutter and the 'heavy' one.  I was also disappointed that this latest Leatherman is made in China.

title: This is far and away the best multitool made
body: I've made my living as a handy man and Ferrier for the past 25 years. This tool lives in my back pocket. I find uses for it at least five times a day. When I don't have it in my back pocket I feel naked. Everything about this tool is well-designed. Be careful to replace the screwdriver heads properly when not in use because you will lose them otherwise.

title: Very good tool.
body: This tool has just a few items on it, but they're the ones you tend to use most. It's well designed and compact. My main complaint is that it has too many sharp edges on it, so it's a bit hard on the hands and clothing. The back of the knife blade is the main culprit. The other thing is the screwdriver bit that is held in by friction. I've had the tool three weeks, and the bit has already fallen out. I think it fell out when I dropped the tool, but that's something that is likely to happen to just about anybody.

title: A fine tool
body: I just got my first multi-tool, the Skeletool CX.  It is a very nice piece of work.  The blade is razor-sharp, and the driver bits work fine - you can use the tool open to 90 degrees and the other leg works as a lever.  I haven't used the pliers for real yet.    I ordered the removable pocket clip and quick-release lanyard ring as well.  Right now it appears to me that they do not work with this tool at all.  I just do not see how to attach them.  The User's Guide is not helpful; it does not mention the Skeletool at all.  Can anyone provide guidance?

title: Unhappy purchase
body: I debated buying this knife for several days and finally broke down and bought it. I got it in and as soon as I opened it there were fingerprints on the blade and grime all over it. I was extremely unhappy :( I went ahead and held onto it for a day and it was extremely useful but I ended up returning it. DO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON. Go to academy!

title: The best multi-tool I've ever owned
body: The Leatherman Skeletool has all the features that I need and use regularly without the extras that my older one has and I've never used.  The belt clip is a great addition, and the light weight makes it much easier to carry.  I highly recommend it.

title: Attractively compact...
body: A very nice tool to have. The blade is perfectly sharpened, It has a good, and the finish on it looks magnificent. It was a bit smaller than I had pictured it, but still, it fits very comfortably inside a pocket or tool belt.If anything, the joints and connections were a bit stiff. Though, I imagine, with a little use they'll be properly manageable in no time.

title: I really like it
body: Been carrying it around with me at all times, and I really like it. It's not overly complex, and it's pretty small.

title: Really like this tool
body: Really like this tool.  The knife stays sharp, have used it to cut open tin can's, still sharp.  Look's cool, not too big and bulky and the pocket clip is perfect.  Doesn't have a lot of bulky gadgets I'll never use.

title: Not the features I need
body: I've coveted this multi-tool for a long time, so when the price dropped below $60, I jumped!  But now I'm not so sure.  I'm a backpacker, not a survivalist, and I'm not terribly hard core.  From my perspective, I want a decent, reliable tool, but it doesn't have to get me through Armageddon (I know there are folks who'll argue with me on that!) My big beef?  This has no can opener, which has been a staple on my backpacking knives for years.  Sure I can bring one of those little floppy ones, but they are so easy to lose!Am contemplating returning this and either getting a Leatherman Juice C2 (wine opener, too - yay!), or I'll go the other direction and get a fixed blade knife, and throw in a few extra small tools... Just not sure what to do with this one now...

title: Excellent Tool
body: I've had Leatherman Tools all my life, and I have only ever used the blades, pliers, bottle openers, and screwdrivers. The Skeletool is an perfectly executed slimming of the older models, and I don't feel silly carrying a three pound pocketknife. The clip on the end has proven to be extremely useful as well.

title: excellent
body: This product is all that you are waiting for, has four tools that you always need: bottle opener, knife, pliers y screwdriver.

title: just plain awesome
body: I am currently wearing this on my belt as i write this review, if you are looking for a lightweight tool that can do it all, this is the one and the blade is nice and sharp. Perfect fit to the hand and great look. Well worth the money

title: Superior
body: This thing is great and there's nothing more to be said about it, other than I'm happy I bought it.

title: Best pocket knife/tool ive ever owned
body: I've owned over 50 pocket knives and none compare to this. This tool is the perfect edition to a simple knife. It can handle most things you  will come across in ur normal life.

title: Serious Tool for a Serious Tool
body: Yup, thats me...a tool that loves tools and this is up there with the best of them.  You can cut a "shotgun hole" in your Pabst while pinching a sorority chicks fine bootay with this bad boy.  Did I mention it looks like part of megatrons innards...freak badass!

title: How cool is this tool?????
body: Haven't purchased a multi-tool in years, and was glad to find one that didn't give me 30 gadgets I'd never use.  LOVE the construction of this one.  Solid yet easy to open/manipulate.  Blade works great.  Doesn't hurt that it looks great too.

title: Always lose the bits
body: The clip that secures your bit in place loosens. Within the first year of owning the Skeletool, Both bits had been lost since they can fall right out. I bought replacement bits and they continue to slip out.

title: Leatherman Skeletool CX
body: This is my second skeletool. I went to the holocaust museum in DC and had my old one in my pocket. I ended up putting it in a trash can because of the security there. A big DOH!     I missed my knife so much I ordered one when we got back.    What I like about the knife is the blade access, the pliers and the screwdriver bits. You can use your thumb to flip out the super-sharp knife blade. The pliers are useful as grips and although wouldnt want to use them for heavy duty chores, are sufficient for most daily uses. The changeable bits are nice when you dont have another screwdriver handy.    I am very satisfied with this knife and would order another one. Amazon shipping was quick, efficient.

title: Love it
body: I've had several of these tools over the years. I've lost several and broke one, but I keep coming back to it. I love the screwdriver options and purchased a pouch that has several other screwdriver inserts which have also been handy.

title: Great tool for EDC
body: This is an excellent compromise between size, weight and functionality.  I have a few different leatherman tools and this is my favorite EDC.  Really good quality and durability.

title: The pliers are extremely weak and are useful only for delicate jobs
body: The pliers are extremely weak and are useful only for delicate jobs. As an essential part of this tool, they are its Achilles heel. The overall feel of this tool is light and delicate. I would recommend looking into a more robust tool if you want more than the feel of a medium pocket knife with a few extra functions.

title: Use it daily
body: This is perfect for me because it's small enough to carry everywhere.  You sacrifice some of the tools you would get with a larger multitool, but the mix they've included is exactly what I need 90% of the time.The build quality is excellent, and it's backed by a 20 year warranty. I haven't had to use the warrant but I've read that others have used it painlessly.

title: The Bomb
body: This is a great tool. Very light, functional, and just cool to look at. I use mine everyday at work, have had zero issues with it. If I lost it tomorrow I would purchase another.

title: Very nice tool. Has everything you need on the go.
body: Bought it for my husband and then for my dad. Both are happy and carry the tool around everywhere. Very nice tool.I purchased this particular model because it featured a good-sized sturdy knife.

title: Five Stars
body: awesome tool...light weight and versatile

title: The ONLY thing I don't like: I wish it had a 'slot' to exchange ...
body: The ONLY thing I don't like:  I wish it had a "slot" to exchange blades.  One of the features of Leatherman tools is swapping blades/accessories.  The blade itself is the only "swapable" accessory.  But really you can do almost anything you'd want with something included already.  For a handy tool I can have at work, I like it.

title: Five Stars
body: bueno

title: Fits in my pocket, still does large jobs
body: I have an older original Leatherman that I used to carry on my belt for work, but this is much better.  It will do what I need it to do most - provide a quickly accessible pair of pliers, screwdriver, or locking blade when needed.  Fits in my pocket and is very lightweight - I never notice it, and takes up only a little more space than my locking knife.  I have the bit driver extension, the 40-bit driver kit, and a belt holster which don't get used all the time, as the tool fits so easily into my pocket that I don't really need them, even though they're nearby.All-in-all, a tremendous light-duty tool that is pretty durable, easy to use, and easily carried.

title: Quality
body: I got this as a present for my best friend. He was super excited, and uses it all the time. I played with it a bit, it's a quality product.

title: CX Skeletool
body: Fit description exactly. Nearly everything about this tool was as expected and Leatherman quality. The only thing wrong was the tension holding in the extra slotted bit. Within the first week mine fell out - luckily I found it and when I replaced it I bent in the slot in the handle. The extra bit hasn't fallen out since.

title: good tool
body: Reading a bunch of other reviews on this.... for the most part I agree. Some are written better than others. Some are written from ignorant people who don't know how to use the tool.      For all that the leatherman comes with.... it's not your typical 'multitool', sure you have your standard pliers/wirecutters/knife and the bit drive is only handy IF you buy the bit kit.    the bits that come with the tool are very...... feminine. they don't have any meat to them.... feel like you might snap them, even though they are made of steel.    When i first saw it, i thought oh sweet that looks awesome    and i still think it's awesome    as for one of the comments I saw about the knife. The gentleman I'm referring to was speaking about the 'one hand' knife open/close..... and unfortunately, unless your name is ralph wiggum or helen keller..... you're not gonna be cutting yourself with the knife. It's very user friendly    Also, the carabiner/bottle opener works quite well at the bar, take it off your belt, pop open a beer and clip it back on. great tool for a college student in and outside of the dorm room.    plus..... it looks cool.      price is a tad bit steep but I guess everyone sacrifices in the hope of looking cool with whatever is trendy then...      leatherman skeletool cx.... thumbs up

title: Great Multi-tool
body: This is my second skeletool, unfortunately I lost my first.  I really like this multi-tool because it is compact, but still has the essential tools you need...a sharp knife, pliers, wire cutter, screwdriver.  The blade holds its edge and the tool seems well made all around.

title: My favorite!
body: This was my favorite tool to carry for a long while.  I lost a number of them and continued to replace them until Leatherman changed the CX blade from a multi-blade to a straight blade, and that combo-edge blade is what I prefer, so I haven't replaced the last one I lost.

title: My GoTo Tool of Choice!
body: Always a fan of Leatherman products, and would recommend this, as well as the bit driver set and extension, as a superlightweight, but hard working, multi-tool.  I have two that I need to ship back to Seattle, but already spoke w/ them and they look forward to receiving and replacing both under warranty.I Love It.

title: My new favorite for EDC
body: My new favorite for EDC.  The seemingly small difference in size/weight when compared to other multitools makes a huge difference.  Shares the back-right pocket along with my wallet and carries great.

title: Be very careful with the pliers because they snap off easily!
body: The Skeletool CX Multitool has been my go to tool for on the road or trail bicycle adjustments and repairs since 2008. Recently one of the pliers noses snapped off when I was using it with only light to moderate force. That surprised me. However, after reading the other reviews and how speedily Leatherman has repaired several other  Skeletool CXs with exactly the same issue and returned them very quickly I was relieved. However, since I was leaving on a month long bike tour in a couple of days I went ahead and bought another one while mine was being repaired. Well, I am home for three weeks before I head out for a two month bike tour, and to my surprise and dismay there is no sign of my old Skeletool CX.  In the past month there has been no communication from Leatherman and no tracking numbers in my USPS account or email. To this point I would have given the Skeletool CX the highest rating, because it is the most important tool I carry on my bicycle trips, but with this slow response I am disappointed. I emailed today and I will call tomorrow, but it should not have broken, and it should already be fixed or replaced under the 25 year warranty.Update: All the above is true about the communications, but my wife just found the package from Leatherman and my repaired Skeletool CX. I have not checked the tracking number yet, but I'll bet it came back fairly quickly. In all fairness, my wife just lost her father, her brother is very ill, and I am off on tours. My apologies. It is my go-to tool, but I am now very careful with the pliers. When I am pulling on a brake or shift cable I don't twist the pliers to bring it taut. Now I have two of them.

title: Five Stars
body: Love it. Leatherman has always been quality.

title: worth the wait
body: I ordered this item in November when I first heard about it and have been waiting on it for 4 months. The only thing I have to say is 'It was worth the wait!' The design is amazing and everything works great. Once again Leatherman has created a great product that iw proudly made in the USA.   The light weight makes it easy to carry in the pocket without being too bulky. The location of the bit driver makes it convenient to use but is hidden when the tool is folded. My first reaction was that it is small( have been carrying a Leatherman Wave), but it fits great in your hand both when the tool is open and closed.

title: Got this cause i co worker got it
body: Got this cause a co worker of mine got it and swore by it.  I liked the streamline of it since i carry in my pocket on the job for a "never know when you need pliers" day.  They do the job, they haven't sheared off like some other reviews however, i personally like Gerber's better, kinda wished i stuck with a gerber but hey don't get me wrong these are good too.

title: The Wave's sexy, air-head sister--oh, how I love her!
body: Oh, how I cherish the Wave.  She's functional, and has oh so many tools.  She can type, file, answer the phone, open a can, cut nylon rope, fix eye glasses, even cut out coupons.  She's attractive--well, I might say presentable--but a bit--I feel like such a jerk--on the heavy side.  But I love her!  She's so steady and helpful!    But some days, I go to reach for the Wave, and there SHE is, in her carbon-fiber dress that's way too short, stiletto heels, and blood red lipstick.  She's standing there all haughty.  Ask her to tighten a tiny screw, and she'll just laugh.  As her to trim some loose threads on your shirt, and she won't even bother acknowledging your presence.  She can't do much, but my God, just look at her.  And really, do men take Paris Hilton out to talk about China's most favored nation trading status?  Do men ask Raquel Welch to do chores around the house?      The Skeletool is not that capable, not that hard-working, but dear Lord, so freaking sexy you want to hit it with a hammer.

title: great item...
body: love the cx. light and handy for those times that you dont want to carry a large and heavy belt tool but want a functional multitool

title: Great product at the best price.
body: Cool tool that replaces a good pocket knife as well as your basic Leatherman.  The knife is sharp and functional without being too large.  The rest is excellent Leatherman quality.  The screw driver set up is innovative and compact. Pocket clip is strong and holds well. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is because of the weight. I would like to see more of the body skeletonized to reduce weight.

title: Good lightweight edc multi tool
body: I am an owner of many leathermans including the wave, blast, sidekick, wingman and a few others.  This one is my favorite for every day carry.  It's very simple.  I got the CX version because I like a better quality knife that is easy to resharpen.  It has a smooth blade, not serrated like the cheaper skeletool.  The metal of the knife is upgraded to hold an edge better.  The carbiner and pocket clip ensure secure ways to carry it.  I lost my first leatherman wave because it fell out of my pocket.  I love the interchangeable bit.  Reminds me of the high quality bit found in the other leathermans, but this one is more lightweight.  I don't even notice it in my pocket.  Not like it's bulky big brothers.  I also got the style ps and cs and it is like a mini replica of the skeletool.  I carry them together and it's an awesome pair.  Ladies go crazy when they see the "baby leatherman" (style cs) with the skeletool cx.

title: AWSOME!
body: THIS IS THE BEST!! the best multitool that I ever had!! I love it, is so simply but perfect. nice for leatherman

title: Five Stars
body: great product

title: This is a great tool!
body: This is my 3rd leather and the best one yet. its light a little smaller then others and one of the best features is you dont have to open main tool to get out knife.

title: Its so lightweight. You literally forget its in your ...
body: Its so lightweight. You literally forget its in your pocket or hanging from your belt loop or belt. I've actually fallen asleep with this thing attached to me and I never feel its presence. The knife is sharper than any other knife I've owned, Kitchen or otherwise. I've owned this for only a couple months and I've used all the tools. They work perfectly.

title: Awesome product
body: I love the Skeletool. My previous leatherman was too big and bulky to carry in a pocket every day, but this one is perfect, and much more useful than just a knife.

title: Good gets Better
body: Had this tool for over a year now and find it a good multi-tool that covers most day to day uses and is something I carry with me in my pocket daily.  However about a week ago while using the pliers to remove a siezed on bolt the tools snapped in two. Lucky it has a limited lifetime waranty as I sent it back and got a new one sent by return return mail : )

title: Hello again Wave,old friend.
body: I had had my Skeletool less than 3 weeks and was making a hook with a piece of clothes hanger wire, when the loud thud on the floor turned out to be the tool's jaw snapping off. It took a couple of weeks to get a replacement, NOW without the serrated portion of the blade. The instructions tell you not to cut or bend wire of a certain gauge which has now led me to relegate the Skeletool to gimmick status. My trusty Wave will continue to be the workhorse that I reach for without thought of damaging it.

title: Needs Oil
body: I'm unhappy with the overall difficulty of opening the skeletool, opening the blade, and removing and inserting the different bits.  Everything just seems very tight.  This tool definitely requires two hands to open which is different from all the other multitools I've worked with.  I'm hoping that it loosens up a bit after more use.  Considering that this is the only problem with the skeletool and since it's a small one I'm going to overlook it and say that this tool has all the quality and functionality that I have come to expect from Leatherman products.

title: Best leatherman ever
body: Finally a Leatherman you can carry everyday without being weighed down. What do you typically need in a given day? Do you need a cork-puller? a leather punch? toothpick? If not, this is what you need. Screwdriver, pliers, knife. DONE. Best  leatherman ever. (plus it looks cool)

title: Plier head snapped off of older version with the serrated blade
body: I purchased the serrated blade model in Nov 2008, and haven't really abused it, but yesterday I broke the plier head. I posted an image of the damage and you can clearly see that the plier teeth are in good condition yet the arm is snapped off. I've seen this exact type of break many times on a pair of craftsman pliers made in China that I had replaced 4 times until they started producing it without the side cutter. On the other hand I've had a pair of pliers made in Japan for >20 years and have never broken them, they are of course good quality steel that does rust quite easily (a self-renewing blackened finish for free!).    The bit holder has also never worked well, in fact mine was so loose from day one that I never knew until recently that it was even there. The groove in the bit probably needs to be larger for it to function properly.    I am mostly curious to find out of the people who also broke the pliers when did they purchase theirs? Is this an issue with older models or all models?

title: Perfect size to carry daily with just the right tools
body: It's a dandy!  Perfect size to carry daily with just the right tools.

title: Solid and reliable.
body: I've owned the Skeletool CX a while now, sometimes as a full time, in my pocket tool - other times just laying around the office.I've found it to be solid - reliable. The blade stays sharp, and the bits stay solid in the handle and socket. The curved shape of the handle is a bit cumbersome and the pliers nice and strong. I keep it clipped inside my pocket, and the clip stays firm and hasn't lost it's tension.Honestly though - with the steel version being so much cheaper than the carbon version - go with that. There's so little difference in the two and the carbon inserts are minor, and purely cosmetic.

title: Great knife, Poor Finish
body: How can anyone go wrong with a Leatherman ? I ordered 2 because, in January, my employer a 3" blade limit and my Leatherman was very close, so I changed to this Leatherman (my 4th) to the Skeletool CX Multitool. The blade is just shy of the requirements.My BIL recommended this knife to me. The biggest problem that I see is that, the black on aluminum finish (durability) is just awful,and worse than my anodized shower. Please shore it up!!!!!!

title: Minimalist
body: Great lightweight pocket tool with just enough features to keep it workable. Being a rigger, I use this tool regularly at work, and the carbon always gets a 'that's cool' remark when it's seen or used by a compadre. The blade holds an edge, the screwdriver is just enough for the quick fix and the pliers are small enought to get into tight spots. But beware, it's not heavy duty. Already had the pliers fixed after a hamfister tried to pry out a frozen 7/32 cotter key.   The 'beener clip is a sure hold when I'm working aloft, and when not working, has opened too many bottles of IPA to count.  Bottom line: I'd buy it again and have as gifts.

title: LEATHERMAN
body: My whole family has leathermans. They are usually a great product. Not this one. a knife tip broke off. Then while it was clipped to my son's pocket the clip broke. What a huge dissapointment. This was 'the coolest leatherman ever made' according to the boys, til this happened.

title: Nice Knife, lousy pliers
body: I was looking for a slim. lite weight multitool that would be easy to carry. This is a slim and lite weight but there is no easy grip handles. When you try to use the pliers, the handles cut into your palm.The wire cutters do not work on lite weight materials. They are like a bad pair of scissors, the wire bends instead of cutting.I would not recommend these to anyone. I will go back to Gerber which has great palm support and the cutters will cut anything large or small.Very disappointed.

title: Lost mine, bought another one
body: This is the perfect balance between size and function.  Pliars, bottle opener, flat and phillips screwdriver, and a blade.  That is really all I need in life.  The carabiner and belt/pocket clip make sure it's always with me.The 154CM blade also holds an edge much better than typical 440 steel does.  That's what you pay for in the CX vs the standard skeletool.Downsides:Carbon fibre is kind-of gimmicky.  The holes drilled in the blade to make it lighter tend to pick up gunk.  If you cut mozzarella cheese with it you will have mozzarella in the holes.  That's it really.  Everything else about this tool is perfect.

title: Great tool except...
body: Great tool except it has a serious safety issue - knife does not have a safety release and opens easily. I bought this as a rigging knife for a sailboat and pretty much had to abandon the intended purpose as having it around became a hazard rather than a safety item. Great if used otherwise though.

title: Outstanding
body: Great piece of Equiptment to carry. Light weight and easy to operate. Would purchase one again,great value.fits perfect in a pocket.

title: great blade for a multitool
body: strong.  great blade for a multitool.  More work oriented no can opener or saw.

title: Best Leatherman Product Yet
body: I've had a few other Leatherman tools, and most were bulky and clumsy. It didnt seem that too much thought/effort went into the design. The Skeletool, however, is completely different. It's almost a work of art. Unlike most other Leatherman tools, this one is lightweight, stylish, comfortable to use, and has exactly what you need for an everyday-carry. Having the blade outside-accessible has got to be the greatest, but most obvious idea ever. It boggles my mind why every other multi-tool puts the blades (or any other tool) on the inside, so that you have to unfold the whole damn thing to get to it, and then have the handles cut into your fingers to use the pliers!! Leatherman finally took a moment to think about it with this tool; I only wish they would re-think some of their other products.      My only gripe with the Skeletool is that they stopped making the CX with the serrated blade, though there is some truth to the idea that the high-quality 154CM will stay so sharp that you dont need serrations, but in my opinion, a half-serrated blade is still ideal.

title: The last leatherman you'll ever buy!
body: Ok 1st off I'll tell you why I bought this, Im a train conductor and needed plyers for removing old gaskets. That's for work, the other reason I bought this is for play. It has a bottle opener. Its light weight and has the tools I need. Blade is super sharp and cuts through anything. I carry this everyday and use it every other day. I recommed this to anyone who wants a leatherman and dosnt want all the junk attachments that you dont use but just the ones you need. A blade, plyers, bottle opener, wire cutters and a phillips/flathead screwdriver.

title: Best EDC muti-tool
body: I love this little guy. I bough it so that I could carry it around with me everyday since a friend spoke highly of it. This thing is great. It has everything that you need and nothing that you don't. At first I thought that I wouldn't ever use the pliers, but I was wrong. I'm very glad that I made this purchase.

title: Off all Leathermans...This is it!
body: I have owned multi-tools for years. I always come back to leatherman.I liked the wingman, wave, supertool, PS (TSA approved until it got confiscated in mexico customs) and they all had that built to last quality. What I found was they were too big or had too many features that I never used. I fell in love with the TSA approved PS but I found myself always needing a knife and the scissors just weren't up to the task.I LOVE the skeletool CX. it has what I need in a tool for an EDC. If I need more for a camping trip or working in the garage, I bring a supertool or wingman. How often are you filing and sawing on a daily basis? Not me I need the knife, light duty pliers (I wouldn't trust something that thin for a serious job) bottle opener and screwdriver/mini prybar. Forget prying things with a knife. Use that perfect little flathead as the perfect do all scraper prybar.

title: Very capable tool
body: The Skeletool has unseated my Wave as my daily carry.  Clipped into a pocket it does not get snagged on a chair arm ect. as my Wave does in it's belt pouch.  Although the Wave is a little more comprehensive and will be my daily carry when camping.  An excellent tool for it's intended purposes.

title: Ad Advertised - great tool that fits into your pocket easily.
body: Purchased this desiring to have a knife with a few more instruments than just the blade.  This has come in quite handy over the past few months that I've owned it.  Fits in hand nicely so you can obtain leverage but it also fits nicely into your pocket so its not bulky - even with casual shorts/pants.

title: certainly worth the hype
body: I've had this for a while now.  When I got it, the blade was razor sharp but also kinda toothy.  Few passes on the stone took care of that.  Carries the same high quality you expect from Leatherman.  I will say that normally I like the utility of using a Gerber to a Leartherman, but this is the exception.  The dlc handle and carbon fiber insert is more or less a gimmick, but does make it look cool.  The better blade steel is an understated selling point.  Very hard, solid blade that beats the competition.      Only con: lost the flat head bit that stays in the handle.  Took forever before it fell out, but it did.  Design problem really.

title: Very Useful Tool!!
body: I love this tool company; all its products are well designed and very functional. I am especially impressed with Leatherman's use of premium 154cm steel in the blade instead of standard cheap stainless steel, which is why I didn't get the standard Skeletool. I also just bought the Charge ALX over the Wave for the same reason. I always laugh when people try to compare Leatherman with Swiss Army Knives. There should be no choice but to buy the Leatherman, unless you just want to pick your nails with it, in which case get the Swiss Army Knife. In short: great product from a great company. Buy one for yourself or as a gift (or both).

title: Awesome Multitool
body: My friend had one of these Leatherman's and so it peaked my interest after I used it a couple of times. It has plenty of useful features that I use on a daily basis. I like the fact that it also has a pocket clip as well so it's easy for me to clip it to my back pocket. I haven't had any issues with it but I've only used it for about a month.

title: Wow that was it?
body: Ive had this for about 6 months. Everything seemed ok but I really only used the screwdriver mostly. Then I tried to pull a nail out of a tire. A small nail and not a screw, and the pliers broke like ceramic. Did I really pay that much for this thing?

title: Very Solid Tool! A+
body: I love this thing! Extraordinary comfort when holding the Skeletool in hand. It is a very solid 5 oz and operates very smooth.  The blade is of great quality and when the tool is in closed possition, it is easy to access.  No need to open the actual thing to gain access to the blade.  I find this a nice selling point for the multi tools that are on Amazon.  I like the fact that it can be secured easily to the body via a sheath (the Skeletool I bought did not come with one but they can always be bought here on Amazon.), a convenient pocket clip, or the carabiner clip put through a belt loop. This will be part of my EDC.  I could write a lot more good stuff about the Skeletool but just know this...you will not be disappointed in its quality and function.  One of my favorite purchases on Amazon!

title: Looks cooler than it acts
body: This is a very bare bones multi tool.  Calling it a multi tool is almost an insult to other multi tools like the wave and the charge.  The grip will hurt your hands in plier mode.  The knife is VERY robust and has an 'edgy' design with most of the cutting edge being curved.  Obviously it is lightweight because it doesn't have very much multi.  The worst part about it is the horrible way the spare bit stows on the side of the tool.  It falls out very easily and could have been designed much better.  For the money, get something else, you'll be glad you did unless you're just absolutely stuck on the light weight and cool styling.

title: Yes but no but yes
body: This is actually a replacement for my previous CX, which was lost snowboarding.  That model (the 2008) was perfect.  It went camping with me, hiking, cut everything from wood to sausage.  This model, the 2009, is exactly the same, sans one feature: they moved the serrated blade to the stainless model.  I am actually kind of disappointed about that as, aside from the quality of the steel and the tungsten coating, it was the most important factor in my decision to purchase this model.      That said, it's the only thing that I dislike about this multi-tool.  It's light, durable, does everything you need and nothing you don't.

title: Good, not great
body: What I Liked:  ** The blade deploys with a single hand from the outside of the multi-tool.  It's also made from 154CM, which is printed right on the blade (I love it when my knives have the blade steel printed on them), and it holds an edge pretty well.  It's not as easy to sharpen as some other steels, but you wont have to do it as often.  ** The bit driver has a release button instead of holding the bits in magnetically, so it's quite a bit sturdier than many other bit drivers.  ** A spare bit can be found tucked away in the handle.  It holds onto it pretty well, too, so you don't have to worry too much about it slipping out.  ** It has a very ergonomic feel in my hand.  ** It's only about 5 ounces.  As the tool's name would suggest, the whole tool has been skeletonized.  The blade and handle have lots of little holes drilled out to reduce the weight.  ** The wire cutters are fantastic!  Maybe I'm just used to the cheap old ones from my dad's garage, but these have far exceeded my expectations.  ** I previously stated that the pliers weren't flush.  My experience has been that it hasn't mattered a bit.  They work great.  The only problem they could ever possible pose is if I needed to pick up a single strand of hair for some reason, an problem which has yet to arise.  ** I bought this about a year ago, and I have to say that I'm pretty impressed with how well the coating on the handle and clip has stood up.  It still looks pretty good, although I don't carry this every day.  Although the same can't be said about the screwdriver bits, which started getting scratched up almost immediately (not really an issue, since it actually looks kind of cool).  ** The bottle opener/carabiner works very well.  It get very frequent use.  What I Disliked:  ** The pocket clip got just a little bit bent out of shape.  I'm not really sure how it happened, either.  It doesn't really hold very firmly in my pocket anymore.  ** Using it as a screwdriver feels a bit awkward in the hand.** The pocket clip is a bit easy to bend (I still don't even know how I did it).  I lost the tool for a couple of weeks.  Thankfully it was just stuck in my car cushions.  Bending it back was simple enough.  ** The lock on the blade seems like it would be easy to depress under heavy use (which is VERY bad for your fingers).  I'd personally recommend going easy on this blade.  If the lock came in from the other side (more like a frame lock) and was a little bit thicker, it would be great for harder use, especially with the thick spine.  The way it is now, though, it would make me uneasy to do much more than cutting up some cardboard.  I would recommend them to anyone who doesn't need all of the extra tools and weight packed into the larger multi-tools.  This is really more of a pocket knife with a decent set of pliers than a full multi-tool to me.  If you're looking for something that's more all encompassing, I'd recommend looking elsewhere (maybe Leatherman's Wave, about the same price with a lot more features).

title: An excellent light-duty tool!
